{"step_by_step_thinking": "Tetrazolium chloride staining is used to assess tissue viability. It stains viable tissue red, while non-viable tissue remains unstained or appears pale. In the case of a myocardial infarction, where there is ischemic damage to the heart muscle, the affected area will appear pale or unstained. Therefore, the color of the infarcted (dead) myocardium after tetrazolium chloride staining will be pale or unstained.", "answer_choice": "B"}
